messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text:
As I mentioned in crbug.com/152843, please consider to use IsKeyboardLayout function instead.

If you feel bad for non-Latin keyboard on login screen like Russian keyboard, please do as separate work. (I recommend getting advise from UX or i18n team's).

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text: nit: Starts or stops

messages.author: alemate
messages.text:
On 2013/07/11 09:43:56, Seigo Nonaka wrote:
> As I mentioned in crbug.com/152843, please consider to use IsKeyboardLayout
> function instead.
> 
> If you feel bad for non-Latin keyboard on login screen like Russian keyboard,
> please do as separate work. (I recommend getting advise from UX or i18n team's).
> 

It has already been discussed a bit in https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=152843 . I think I'll add people from UX & i18n there.

messages.author: alemate
messages.text:
On 2013/07/11 09:43:56, Seigo Nonaka wrote:
> nit: Starts or stops

Done.

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text: nit: no need to add OS_CHROMEOS. This class is only used in chromeos environment.

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text: If you put DCHECK, please remove this condition, if local_state can be NULL, please remove DCHECK.

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text:
no need to check manager, you already put DCHECK above.
I think this shouldn't be NULL, so just DCHECK is fine :)

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text: ditto.

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text: Please note that third party input can set any language, so we should check IsKeyboardLayout.

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: Not needed, local_state != NULL should be guaranteed by initialization order. If it's not, you have bigger problems :)

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: Does this singleton getter actually return NULL in any circumstance? Being overly defensive makes code unreadable.

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: *Updater

> environment.

Done.

> it's not, you have bigger problems :)

Done.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: No need for OS_CHROMEOS here as this class is already located in chromeos specific folder.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: same here.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: drop this check.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: What about relying on stubs instead when not running on a real Chrome OS VM image/device?

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: Drop this DCHECK.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: Drop this.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: Drop this DCHECK.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text:
You should delete this loop it is not really needed.
My proposal:

Have a utility method that tries to switch to user specific input method and returns bool. Code that calls it will switch to default if needed.

Introducing this method will also help split this method into smaller parts.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text:
nit: I guess it is perfectly normal situation till at least one user signs in that has latin-based input_methods.

No need for DLOG(WARNING) here.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: Same here. This looks like a perfectly normal (rare but normal) situation so no need for DLOG(WARNING).

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text:
You don't have to check for manager not being NULL. It is assumed it is always not NULL when we are accessing it. You could check its lifetime if you want.

If this assumption is not true this code better crash and generate crash report instead of doing nothing.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: Drop DCHECK

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: Same here.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: I propose dropping log message as well and just doing pref cleanup instead.

messages.author: Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: -> should be on the previous line

Nikita Kostylev
Nikita Kostylev
messages.text: nit: No need for DLOG(WARNING), perfectly normal situation.

> nit: I guess it is perfectly normal situation till at least one user signs in
> that has latin-based input_methods.
> 
> No need for DLOG(WARNING) here.

Do all our users always have some latin input method enabled ?
Probably HW-default is always enabled, I think.

messages.text:

> nit: Same here. This looks like a perfectly normal (rare but normal) situation
> so no need for DLOG(WARNING).

But it's debug log, isn't it? I think I'd better have a trace of rare events at least in debug log.

It is probably dangerous to silently drop user preferences. I've added pref cleanup, but left log message. Do you think it is OK now?

Done.

> nit: this looks more readable:
> 
> chromeos::input_method::InputMethodManager::Get()->
>     ChangeInputMethod(input_method);

Done.

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text: Please notice that there is "xkb:jp::jpn" keyboard which is for Latin character input in jp109 keyboard. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keyboard_layout#Japanese)

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: nit: Starts

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: nit: ContainOnlyKeyboardLayout should be ContainsOnlyKeyboardLayout (imperative "contain" certainly doesn't make sense here).

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: nit: new code should refer to crbug.com IMHO

messages.author: alemate
messages.text:
On 2013/07/11 09:43:56, Seigo Nonaka wrote:
> Please notice that there is "xkb:jp::jpn" keyboard which is for Latin character
> input in jp109 keyboard. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keyboard_layout#Japanese)
> 

That's a good point. I've been waiting for something like that. ;-)

I think I should extend this structure to keep a list of "explicitly allowed keyboards for this language".
NULL would mean "any". So that I can have only one list for "jp" with a single entry "xkb:jp::jpn" for now.

messages.author: alemate
messages.text:
On 2013/07/11 10:05:49, Mattias Nissler wrote:
> nit: Starts

Done.

> "contain" certainly doesn't make sense here).

Done.

messages.author: alemate
messages.text:

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: nit: Missing period, not using the full line width on line 2507 for the comment.

messages.author: Mattias Nissler (OOO till Nov)
messages.text: This should be earlier in this file (the file as three sections "PROFILE PREFS", "LOCAL STATE", "SERVICE PREFS") in the "LOCAL STATE" section, note that there's a whole section of Chrome OS section there where you can add your pref. I know I'm fighting a lost battle here, but still :)

messages.author: alemate
messages.text:
